sentence.Network_en: Neither side would have an incentive to start a war. Ergo, peace would reign.
sentence.Network_cn: 双方都不会有开战的动机，所以将会是和平时期。

sentence.Network_en: Ergo, these facilities have been marked as the likely rail transfer points.
sentence.Network_cn: 因此, 这些地方也已经被标示为可能的铁路转运点.

sentence.Network_en: And, ergo, his buddy is guaranteed a profit.
sentence.Network_cn: 因此他朋友就必定能从中捞一笔.

encyclopedia.content: 拉丁语 1. 拉丁单词：【音标】： [] 【词典解释】：副词 ad. 1. 【拉】因此； 另见：Cogito ergo sum中的ergo是“我”的意思，这句话意为“我思故我在”。这句话出自于法国数学家笛卡尔的法文著作《Discours de la Methode》中。 2. 英文单词：【音标】： [] 四字母单词Ergo，在字典上较难找到该词在英文中的含义，但在英语母语国家却是一个行业常用词汇。 Ergo为形容词Ergonomic或其名词Ergonomics的简称。 Ergonomics在国内常译

entry.def: Ergo is sometimes used instead of 'therefore' to introduce a clause in which you mention something that is the consequence or logical result of what you have just said.

example.ex: Neither side would have an incentive to start a war. Ergo, peace would reign.
example.tran: 双方都不会有开战的动机，所以将会是和平时期。

means.word_mean: 1. (used as a sentenced connector) therefore or consequently

auth_sentence.content: Ergo, physical labor equals a healthy life style.
